title_narrative: Mine Action and Cluster Munitions Programme -Libya
description_narrative: This humanitarian mine action project will be implemented over a period of 48 months, from 1 September 2020 – 31 August 2024. Through a combination of land release and explosive ordnance risk education activities, and supporting the development of a sustainable national capacity, the project will contribute to reducing the threat to life and improving mobility, access to services and livelihoods in target communities.
result_title_narrative: Outcome 2: Productive land use improves livelihoods and access to basic services for men and women
Outcome 1: Risk of harm reduced through safer behaviour, and land release
Outcome 3: Mine Action is better managed, regulated, coordination increasing transition of sector to national/local ownership

result_indicator_baseline_comment_narrat: In the first target location two female EORE operators have been recruited and trained in October-November 2020. Currently one NTS team is under recruitment, to be finalized by the end of February 2021, and it is planned one women is planned to be recruited and trained in this team.
Post Impact Surveys have been developed and integration into MEAL system is ongoing, baseline data collection will commence once tasking orders are received to define the area of operations.
result_indicator_period_actual_comment_n: It is too early to report on this indicator, reporting is anticipated to commence in the second half of 2021 Survey of beneficiaries will commence in August 2021.

It is too early to report on this indicator since activities are ongoing. Programme and MEAL teams are developing relevant impact measurement tools to focus on impact behavioural change in communities at least one semester after activities have been completed- to start reporting in quarter 4 2022
